body_html: A couple days ago, @csarofeen pointed out that the non-cudnn and cudnn versions of bidirectional RNN behave differently. With cudnn, forward and backward directions are linearly independent. So if you are certain that you are using cudnn, it will work fine for you. That said, this is an inconsistency that we should fix.

body: A couple days ago, @csarofeen pointed out that the non-cudnn and cudnn versions of bidirectional RNN behave differently. With cudnn, forward and backward directions are linearly independent. So if you are certain that you are using cudnn, it will work fine for you. That said, this is an inconsistency that we should fix.
